questions.question: What is the chemical formula of the spin crossover material discussed?
At what temperature range does the spin crossover phenomenon occur in the FeII–MoIV assembly?
Is thermal hysteresis observed in the spin crossover of the FeII–MoIV assembly?
questions.answer: No, thermal hysteresis is not observed.

questions.question: What percentage of the high-spin FeII sites changes to low-spin FeII sites?
What causes the incomplete and gradual spin crossover in the FeII–MoIV assembly?
questions.answer: The incomplete and gradual spin crossover is attributed to the elastic frustration between the high-spin and the low-spin FeII sites.

questions.question: What is the space group of the FeII–MoIV assembly's cubic crystal structure?
Does the FeII–MoIV assembly exhibit a complete spin crossover?
questions.answer: False, it exhibits an incomplete spin crossover.

questions.question: What method was used to synthesize single crystals of the FeII–MoIV assembly?
What is the role of 1-(3-pyridyl)ethanol in the FeII–MoIV assembly?
questions.answer: 1-(3-pyridyl)ethanol acts as an organic ligand in the cyanido-bridged SCO network.

questions.question: Is the spin crossover in the FeII–MoIV assembly gradual or abrupt?
questions.answer: True, the spin crossover in the FeII–MoIV assembly is gradual.

questions.question: What analytical technique confirmed the presence of terminal and bridging cyanides in FeMo?
questions.answer: IR spectrum analysis confirmed the presence.

questions.question: What causes the steep decrease in χMT value below 20 K in the FeII–MoIV assembly?
questions.answer: The steep decrease is due to the zero-field splitting of the remaining FeII HS sites and the antiferromagnetic interactions.

questions.question: Does the FeII–MoIV assembly's crystal structure change significantly with temperature?
questions.answer: False, the crystal structure does not change significantly with temperature.

questions.question: What is the effect of temperature on the UV–vis absorption spectra of FeMo?
questions.answer: The UV–vis absorption spectra exhibit a strong temperature dependence.

questions.question: Can the FeII–MoIV assembly be used for memory devices?
questions.answer: True, materials exhibiting spin crossover are attractive for memory devices.

questions.question: What is the crystal system of the FeII–MoIV assembly?
What is the significance of the racemic organic ligand in the synthesis of the FeII–MoIV assembly?
questions.answer: The racemic organic ligand simplifies the synthetic approach and helps realize a 3D cyanido-bridged SCO network.

questions.question: Is the spin crossover in the FeII–MoIV assembly attributed to the presence of chiral ligands?
questions.answer: False, the spin crossover is attributed to elastic frustration and not directly to the presence of chiral ligands.

questions.question: What is the role of thermal and light-induced spin crossover in the FeII–MoIV assembly?
questions.answer: They control the optical and electric properties of the material.

questions.question: Does the FeII–MoIV assembly exhibit nonlinear optical properties?
questions.answer: False, the centrosymmetric SCO compound does not exhibit nonlinear optical properties.
